briefdescription.para: Opaque data type representing a list of timeouts and a set of DBusAddTimeoutFunction/DBusRemoveTimeoutFunction.

detaileddescription.para: Automatically handles removing/re-adding timeouts when the DBusAddTimeoutFunction is updated or changed. Holds a reference count to each timeout.

briefdescription.para: function to run when the timeout is handled

memberdef.argsstring: (int interval, DBusTimeoutHandler handler, void *data, DBusFreeFunction free_data_function)
memberdef.name: _dbus_timeout_new

briefdescription.para: Creates a new DBusTimeout, enabled by default.

parameterdescription.para: function to call when the timeout occurs.
data to pass to the handler
function to be called to free the data.

briefdescription.para: Increments the reference count of a DBusTimeout object.
Decrements the reference count of a DBusTimeout object and finalizes the object if the count reaches zero.

detaileddescription.para: Note that you have to disable and re-enable the timeout using the timeout toggle function (_dbus_connection_toggle_timeout_unlocked() etc.) to notify the application of this change.

Note that you should use _dbus_connection_toggle_timeout_unlocked() etc. instead, if the timeout is passed out to an application main loop. i.e. you can't use this function in the D-Bus library, it's only used in the message bus daemon implementation.

parameterdescription.para: TRUE if timeout should be enabled.

detaileddescription.para: Returns NULL if insufficient memory exists.

simplesect.para: the new timeout list, or NULL on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (DBusTimeoutList *timeout_list, DBusAddTimeoutFunction add_function, DBusRemoveTimeoutFunction remove_function, DBusTimeoutToggledFunction toggled_function, void *data, DBusFreeFunction free_data_function)
memberdef.name: _dbus_timeout_list_set_functions

detaileddescription.para: This function is the "backend" for dbus_connection_set_timeout_functions().

parameterdescription.para: the function to free the data.

briefdescription.para: Adds a new timeout to the timeout list, invoking the application DBusAddTimeoutFunction if appropriate.

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE If no memory.

briefdescription.para: Removes a timeout from the timeout list, invoking the application's DBusRemoveTimeoutFunction if appropriate.
Sets a timeout to the given enabled state, invoking the application's DBusTimeoutToggledFunction if appropriate.
